page.title: 06THE VILLAGE OF FITZHEAD
page.content: Fitzhead is a small village with a good community group which organises beetle drives,rounders matches and treasure hunts.Almost everyone attends the village fete and flower show. In winter there is sledging on a nearby hill.In summer many support the local cricket team.A stream runs through the lower part of the village,which people like to paddle in on hot days.Fitzhead and the surrounding area is a popular place for horse riding. An oak bench was donated to the churh by an American family to celebrate the marriage of their ancestors in the village in 1585. The 15th century screen and the church plate are the greatest treasures.The church shares a magazine with Milverton and Halse.
